title: 1975 Triumph TR6

description: The Triumph TR6 (1969–76) was a British six-cylinder sports car and the best-seller of the TR range built by Triumph when production ended in July 1976. This record was then surpassed by the TR7. 91,850 TR6s were built.

All TR6 sports cars featured inline six-cylinder engines. For the US market the engine was carburetted, as had been the US-only TR250 model's engine. For other world markets including England, the TR6 was fuel-injected as had been the non-US market TR5. The Lucas mechanical fuel injection system helped the home-market TR6 produce 150 bhp at model introduction. Later the non-US TR6 variant was detuned to 125 hp in order for it to be easier to drive, while the US-variant continued to be carburetted with a mere 104 hp.

The TR6 featured a four speed manual transmission. An optional equipment overdrive unit was a desirable feature because it gave drivers close-gearing for aggressive driving, yet "long legs" for open motorways. TR6 also featured independent rear suspension, rack and pinion steering, fifteen inch wheels and tires, pile carpet on floors and boot, bucket seats, and a full complement of instrumentation. Braking was accomplished by disc brakes in the front; drum brakes in the rear. A factory steel hard top was optional. TR6 construction was fundamentally old-fashioned: the body was bolted onto a frame instead of the two being integrated into a unibody structure; the TR6 dashboard was wooden (plywood w/ veneer).
Besides the TR250 and TR5, the TR6 was also preceded by a series of four-cylinder Triumph TRs: TR2, TR3, TR3A, TR4, and TR4A. TR6 was succeeded by the four-cylinder TR7 and the eight-cylinder TR8.
The Triumph TR6 is supported by active clubs and reliable service parts suppliers.

This very nice example has been restored to a very nice, near show quality level. The Interior and brightwork are without fault, the top is new, the wheels and tires are excellent, and the car is rust free with a nicely detailed engine compartment and undercarriage. While the paint is quite nice, its not a concours paint job. Upon close inpection there are a few minor dings here and there, and an occassional run.
A triple Weber Carb set up, which evidently was used in Europe for Rallying and includes a beefer Cam and dual exhaust, and a Roll bar have been added.
This is one of the better Tr6's we have had the opportunity to represent. This is a fine example that will provide years of driving enjoyment.
title: 1972 Triumph TR6

title: 1970 Triumph TR6

description: The Triumph TR6 is the last of the traditional British Roadsters. These cars offer a pure, open air, sports car motoring experience that is unique to the marquee. The sound, the feel and the handling is something that any auto enthusiast should experience. Their traditional design, mechanical reliability and parts availability make them easy to own and enjoy. For these reasons, they have become proven investments.

The 1970 Triumph TR-6 offered here is powered by its 2.5 liter inline 6 cylinder engine, 4 speed transmission and rear wheel drive. The interior features bucket seats, floor shift and door panels with excellent pockets. It also features the small chrome bumpers that are fully desirable in this day.  Highlights include newer yellow paint, newer black interior, newer wood dash fascia, factory 3 spoke steering wheel, upgraded radio, center fuel fill, radiator shroud, dual SU carbs, 112 volt charging system, Red Stripe Tires, newer convertible top, excellent chrome and bright work.

Mechanically, this TR6 pulls strong in every gear, handles great, and brakes straight. It is a spirited driver that gives a true British open air experience. The Triumph TR-6 is a car that is accepted in any automotive circle. It gives a pure sports car experience that is not available in today’s models. The TR-6 is a pure, un-refined and awesome. It never gets old.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com
title: 1970 Triumph TR6

description: This 1976 example is one of the last models produced and is finished in a rare and fetching shade of Tahiti Blue. The paintwork shows very nicely and has an even finish. The little bit of patina on the paintwork and bright trim is very tasteful and adds to the all original charm. Tahiti blue was only offered for the last year of production and numbers are limited. All original chrome trim is accounted for and shines nicely. The car’s interior is finished in a nice tan color and is in excellent shape. There is no visible wear and everything seems to be functioning properly. Even the wooden dash is in great shape with no fading or cracks. The black soft top is in great shape, doesn’t leak and folds away easily. The car fires right up, pulls well, and sounds strong. The transmission shifts smoothly and the clutch has good bite.

The upmarket TR6 came with a lot of standard features including full instrumentation, a walnut-veneer fascia, a leather wrapped steering wheel and dual exhaust. This TR6 has the minilite style alloy wheels, power brakes, wood gear knob, an upgraded Pertronix ignition, optional factory hardtop and more. With lots of paperwork and history, this three owner, low mile TR6 is one of the nicest ones we’ve seen and the rare color really raises the desirability factor.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

description: Classic Triumph TR6 in excellent condition.  After spending a couple of years in Manchester MA with a loving owner, this TR6 is back with us again for sale with some nice upgrades.  Karmann of Germany had done a masterful job of updating the body shell.  The 2.5 liter straight six has plenty of torque and makes some of the best sounds in sports cardom.  TR6s are easy to maintain, good-looking, rugged and have easy parts availability.  They make an ideal first collector car.  This TR6 is rust free and the body has no rot issues in areas that are common for these cars.  Mechanically this TR6 runs and drives exactly as it should, is mechanically sound and has had a carburetor upgrade.  This past year some interior refurbishment, new shocks and springs.

title: 1976 Triumph TR6

description: The Triumph TR6 was a best-selling British sports car built between 1968 and 1976. It has long been the favorite of British sports car aficionados around the world thanks to its good looks, great handling and solid performance. The number of car clubs dedicated to the car attest to its popularity.     This 1969 Triumph TR6 represents the breed especially well. Looking great in green and black, it draws attention without shouting. The engine moves the car with alacrity, humming smoothly under the hood and transferring power to the wheels through a well-matched four speed manual transmission. This is a driving machine, and the whole experience of the car reinforces that impression.     If you're the previous owner of a TR6, and rue the day you sold the car, this is your chance to turn back time. Live those top-down glory days once again. For those of you who have never yet owned a TR6, this is your chance to join the club--literally. You will enjoy the car itself, of course, but you might be surprised at how much you also enjoy the camaraderie of fellow British sports car enthusiasts. It's like a family, and you'll be warmly welcomed.    Don't just stand there on the outside looking in! Call Art & Speed today at (901) 850-0507. We'd love to introduce you to some friends.
Financing

description: 1972 Triumph TR6 for Sale.  Here's a British Classic that's sure to turn heads wherever you cruise. Finished in bright red with a contrasting black top and interior along with a rear boot cover.  Powered by 2.5L straight six with twin Stromberg Carbs and mated to a 4 speed manual transmission.  The interior is finished in bucket seats and console.  This British Sports car has the room to fit a six foot person with comfort.  A woodgrain dash and steering wheel add to the car's sporty look.  The sharp red exterior is accented by a set of factory rally styled wheels carrying Yokohama radials in 205/65R 15.  Other features include an upholstered trunk and luggage rack.  Ready for some fun in the sun!  Drop the top, find a quiet highway, and listen to the smooth running motor as you run through the gears!  Sure to provide countless hours of enjoyable cruising!
